Module chessXX
Package Main

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Main.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Board
    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game is class used to play the game chess
    Author:
    Maury Johnson

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static Player Me
      Me is object Player used in game and it stores info about current player
      static Player Opponent
      Opponent is object Player used in game and it stored info about the current opponent

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Game​(Player P1, Player P2)
      Game constructor takes Player objects and then stores it to its fields Me and Opponent

      Check if Player Me is in check

      Check if opponent is in check

      PRint all the statuses of pieces
      void PrintPlayers()
      Print the players me and opponent
      void ReturnStatus​(int[] R)
      Basic Return status of movement but don't actually perform movement Requires method TryMove which is any implemented move by a piece as a parameter
      int ReturnStatusMove​(int[] R)
      Returns status of movement tried, including check/checkmate, requires method Trymove as parameter, which is implemented from a piece
      void SwapPlayer()
      Swap field Player Me with field Opponent, Player1->Player2

      Convert character for board coordinate to integer
      int TryMoveFromInput​(java.lang.String s)
      Try Move From Input, return 0 success, -1 fail, 1 Opponent is in Check
